jobPostingInfo.title: Resource Analyst IV
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

In this role you will:

  • Collaborate with the Manager of Office 2502 to achieve Division 25’s business goals, utilizing the Institution’s business framework and processes.
  • Serve as a team member conducting Earned Value Management (EVM) surveillance (compliance) reviews of JPL projects with minimal supervision.
  • Analyze project EVM cost and schedule data to identify non-compliances and discrepancies between projects’ implementation of EVM and requirements such as those described in the JPL EVM System Description and the EIA-748 EVM standard.
  • Conduct data analysis and prepare findings as part of Integrated Baseline Reviews (IBRs).Co-lead IBRs conducted on project subcontracts.
  • Perform ad hoc special projects, analyses, and reviews of Division and sponsor policies, processes, and documentation related to EVM.
  • Lead EVM training for Control Account Managers and other project business team members. Assist in the development of EVM training materials as needed.
  • Present EVM surveillance findings to Project Management and Project Business Teams as required.
  • Act as a CMIO Point of Contact (POC) to projects and provide oversight over these activities:
    • Provide business management support to project teams, including assistance with EVM planning and baseline establishment, development of EVM work products, and expert EVM guidance on EVM implementation/execution
    • Communicate key EVM matters to appropriate project and line personnel
    • Provide EVM surveillance and compliance interface with business contacts within JPL, NASA HQ, and other organizations
    • Develop and maintain effective working relationships across the JPL business community
  • Promote and foster best business practices in accordance with established Institutional processes and procedures and in accordance with the Prime Contract
    • Develop and implement business processes and products as required by PBMD and the Institution
    • Promote employee awareness of best business practices and standards
    • Contribute to, and actively support, long-range institutional initiatives, including Enterprise 2.0

Qualifications

Typically requires a Bachelor degree in Business Administration or similar discipline with a minimum of 9 years of related experience; Master’s degree in similar discipline with a minimum of 7 years of related experience; or PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 5 years related experience.

  • Thorough knowledge of EVM as defined by the 32 Guidelines of the EIA-748 standard, and familiarity with interpreting the Guidelines in terms of EVM compliance
  • Significant experience in analyzing large, complex data sets, interpreting results, and developing recommendations
  • Breadth of experience in managing and implementing cost and schedule planning, forecasting, analysis, earned value performance measurement, assessment and reporting, project controls, cost estimation & pricing, contracts, subcontracts, and procurements.
  • Demonstrated ability to meet rapidly changing project needs and manage competing priorities.
  • Ability to maintain an objective perspective in assessment and communication of performance.
  • Effective communication skills in verbal, written, and presentation forms.
  • Experience interfacing effectively with all levels of program/project management, technical organizations, peers, subcontractors, and the sponsor.
  • Demonstrated ability to work on critical, often self-initiated, assignments under only consultative direction, typically exercising considerable latitude in determining objectives.
  • Experience in interpreting and carrying out policies, processes, procedures, applicable laws, regulations, and government contract requirements
  • Ability to travel up to 10% based on business requirements

Preferred Qualifications

  • Hands-on experience with advanced EVM tools (e.g., Cobra, Empower, MS Project, and similar applications), processes, and techniques
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel and MS Office applications
  • Thorough knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, applicable prime contract requirements, NASA procedural requirements, and government regulations across a range of applications.
  • Sustained successful demonstration of expertise, ability, and authority in performing in a business leadership role on a complex technical development.
  • Interest in, and experience with, organizational change management, process definition, and process improvement

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
